title: Jeanne Dielman, 23 Quai du Commerce, 1080 Bruxelles
sas_caption: A magnificent epic of experimental cinema offering a feminist perspective on recurrent events of everyday life.
imdb_caption: A lonely widowed housewife does her daily chores, takes care of her apartment where she lives with her teenage son, and turns the occasional trick to make ends meet. However, something happens that changes her safe routine.

title: Vertigo
sas_caption: A former detective with a fear of heights is hired to follow a woman apparently possessed by the past, in Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless thriller about obsession.
imdb_caption: A former San Francisco police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with the hauntingly beautiful woman he has been hired to trail, who may be deeply disturbed.

title: Citizen Kane
sas_caption: Famously sitting at the top of the Sight and Sound Greatest Films of All Time poll from 1962 to 2002, Orson Welles’s debut, about newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane, remains an enduring classic.
imdb_caption: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance: 'Rosebud.'

title: Tokyo Story
sas_caption: Told in Yasujirō Ozu’s simple and elegant style, this story of intergenerational discord is heartbreaking and deeply human.
imdb_caption: An old couple visit their children and grandchildren in the city, but receive little attention.

title: In the Mood for Love
sas_caption: Wong Kar Wai’s masterpiece is a heartbreaking story of illicit love that pulses with the ache of repressed desire.
imdb_caption: Two neighbors form a strong bond after both suspect extramarital activities of their spouses. However, they agree to keep their bond platonic so as not to commit similar wrongs.

title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
sas_caption: Stanley Kubrick’s grand vision of mankind’s journey from its hominid beginnings to its star-child evolution is a towering achievement of science-fiction cinema.
imdb_caption: After uncovering a mysterious artifact buried beneath the Lunar surface, a spacecraft is sent to Jupiter to find its origins: a spacecraft manned by two men and the supercomputer HAL 9000.

title: Beau travail
sas_caption: Claire Denis’s great gift is to evoke emotion with gesture and juxtaposition. In the desert, water shimmers and ripples, naked shoulders perspire, black mosquito nets recall sheer lingerie.
imdb_caption: An ex-Foreign Legion officer recalls his once-glorious life of leading troops in Djibouti.

title: Mulholland Dr.
sas_caption: Hollywood is dark and dangerous, yet alluring, in David Lynch’s acclaimed thriller.
imdb_caption: After a car wreck on the winding Mulholland Drive renders a woman amnesiac, she and a perky Hollywood-hopeful search for clues and answers across Los Angeles in a twisting venture beyond dreams and reality.

title: Man with a Movie Camera
sas_caption: Bottomless invention and frenetic, dizzying montage make this city symphony one of cinema’s sharpest, most exciting experiences nearly a century after its release.
imdb_caption: A man travels around a city with a camera slung over his shoulder, documenting urban life with dazzling invention.

title: Singin' in the Rain
sas_caption: Hollywood’s troubled transition from silent to talking pictures at the end of the 1920s provided the inspiration for perhaps the greatest of movie musicals.
imdb_caption: A silent film star falls for a chorus girl just as he and his delusionally jealous screen partner are trying to make the difficult transition to talking pictures in 1920s Hollywood.

title: Sunrise: A Song of Two Humans
sas_caption: The first American film by one of German expressionism’s leading exponents, this lush, atmospheric silent drama is replete with groundbreaking cinematography.
imdb_caption: A sophisticated city woman seduces a farmer and convinces him to murder his wife and join her in the city, but he ends up rekindling his romance with his wife when he changes his mind at the last moment.

title: The Godfather
sas_caption: The first of Francis Ford Coppola’s epic trilogy about the Corleone crime family is the disturbing story of a son drawn inexorably into his father’s Mafia affairs.
imdb_caption: Don Vito Corleone, head of a mafia family, decides to hand over his empire to his youngest son Michael. However, his decision unintentionally puts the lives of his loved ones in grave danger.

title: La Règle du jeu
sas_caption: Huge-spirited and sharp-eyed, Jean Renoir’s French-society fresco gathers high classes and low for a weekend of country-house fallout.
imdb_caption: A bourgeois life in France at the onset of World War II, as the rich and their poor servants meet up at a French chateau.

title: Cléo from 5 to 7
sas_caption: In real time, Cléo becomes more real, more subject than object. She discards her whipped-cream wig and polka dots for a simple black shift. She performs less and feels more.
imdb_caption: Cleo, a singer and hypochondriac, becomes increasingly worried that she might have cancer while awaiting test results from her doctor.

title: The Searchers
sas_caption: This poll’s last western standing, John Ford’s sweeping, stirring rescue-or-revenge quest remains a film of magnificent mystery and poetry.
imdb_caption: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a years-long journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches after the rest of his brother's family is massacred in a raid on their Texas farm.

title: Meshes of the Afternoon
sas_caption: Had Californian sunlight ever looked as suggestive or sinister before the sharply etched dreamworld of Meshes of the Afternoon?
imdb_caption: A woman returning home falls asleep and has vivid dreams that may or may not be happening in reality. Through repetitive images and complete mismatching of the objective view of time and space, her dark inner desires play out on-screen.

title: Close-up
sas_caption: The more ‘information’ we’re offered about the case, the more we come to realise that there are no easy answers to any of the questions being raised.
imdb_caption: The true story of Hossain Sabzian, a cinephile who impersonated the director Mohsen Makhmalbaf to convince a family they would star in his so-called new film.

title: Persona
sas_caption: Any sense of a conventional psychodrama is constantly disrupted by the experimental, improvisatory filmmaking.
imdb_caption: A nurse is put in charge of a mute actress and finds that their personae are melding together.

title: Apocalypse Now
sas_caption: Francis Ford Coppola’s Vietnam War blowout, a hell-trip through the smoke and dazzle of imperial America’s most grandstanding rogue show.
imdb_caption: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.

title: Seven Samurai
sas_caption: Akira Kurosawa’s monumental, scintillating tale of hired samurai protecting a peasant village: period thriller and moral/political fable in one.
imdb_caption: Farmers from a village exploited by bandits hire a veteran samurai for protection, who gathers six other samurai to join him.

title: Late Spring
sas_caption: The first of Yasujirō Ozu’s great cycle of dramas that place the joys and sadnesses of family life in the context of a Japan disrupted by modernity.
imdb_caption: Several people try to talk 27-year-old Noriko into marrying, but all she wants is to keep on caring for her widowed father.

title: The Passion of Joan of Arc
sas_caption: Carl Theodor Dreyer’s rapturous silent masterpiece, with soulful close-ups of Renée Jeanne “Maria” Falconetti’s tremulous martyr, transcending tyranny and temporality.
imdb_caption: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

title: Playtime
sas_caption: Jacques Tati’s most painstaking accomplishment blends deft slapstick, endless visual ingenuity and sonic comedy in a stupendous modern satire.
imdb_caption: Monsieur Hulot curiously wanders around a high-tech Paris, paralleling a trip with a group of American tourists. Meanwhile, a nightclub/restaurant prepares its opening night, but it's still under construction.

title: Do the Right Thing
sas_caption: Racial tensions reach boiling point in Spike Lee’s incandescent portrait of a Brooklyn neighbourhood on the hottest day of the year.
imdb_caption: On the hottest day of the year on a street in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn, everyone's hate and bigotry smolders and builds until it explodes into violence.

title: Au hasard Balthazar
sas_caption: Robert Bresson gave us a typically stark vision of humanity as experienced by a put-upon, maltreated beast of burden that passes from owner to owner.
imdb_caption: The story of a mistreated donkey and the people around him. A study on saintliness and a sister piece to Bresson's Mouchette.

title: The Night of the Hunter
sas_caption: Actor Charles Laughton’s only film as director, starring Robert Mitchum as an implacable child-hunting preacher, still leaves an indelible mark.
imdb_caption: A self-proclaimed preacher marries a gullible widow whose young children are reluctant to tell him where their real dad hid the $10,000 he'd stolen in a robbery.

title: Shoah
sas_caption: To make sense of the 20th century’s most horrific atrocity, Claude Lanzmann reinvented documentary itself, giving the form colossal new significance.
imdb_caption: Claude Lanzmann's epic documentary recounts the story of the Holocaust through interviews with witnesses - perpetrators as well as survivors.

title: Daisies
sas_caption: This feminist milestone is an anarchic comedy of subversion whose approach to montage is as exuberant as the film’s two protagonists.
imdb_caption: After realizing that all world is spoiled, Marie and Marie are committed to be spoiled themselves. They rip off older men, feast in lavish meals and do all kinds of mischief. But what is all this leading to?

title: Taxi Driver
sas_caption: Martin Scorsese and Paul Schrader’s high-art vigilante movie for fallen times, with a coiled Robert De Niro as psycho-saviour of an infernal NYC.
imdb_caption: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action.

title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire
sas_caption: Portrait of a Lady on Fire demonstrates Céline Sciamma’s ability to make a timelessly beautiful film that also crystallises the gender politics of her era.
imdb_caption: On an isolated island in Brittany at the end of the eighteenth century, a female painter is obliged to paint a wedding portrait of a young woman.

sas_caption: Federico Fellini’s portrait of the film director as harried ringmaster and unreliable dreamer, spinning gold from his memories and fantasies.
imdb_caption: A harried movie director retreats into his memories and fantasies.

title: Mirror
sas_caption: Cinema scaled new heights of visual poetry in this deeply personal, elliptical film by the master of ‘sculpting in time’.
imdb_caption: A dying man in his forties remembers his past. His childhood, his mother, the war, personal moments and things that tell of the recent history of all the Russian nation.

title: Psycho
sas_caption: Alfred Hitchcock’s unsparing wrong-motel shocker starring Janet Leigh is a watershed for mainstream horror and still seminal in its suspense games.
imdb_caption: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

title: L'Atalante
sas_caption: Jean Vigo’s headily poetic portrait of young newlyweds on – and off – Michel Simon’s barge on the Seine.
imdb_caption: Newly married couple Juliette and a ship captain Jean struggle through marriage as they travel on the L'atalante along with the captain's first mate Le père Jules and a cabin boy.

title: Pather Panchali
sas_caption: All the mischief, discoveries, joys and tragedies of life are given endlessly lyrical expression in Satyajit Ray’s debut, the first entry in ‘The Apu Trilogy’.
imdb_caption: Impoverished priest Harihar Ray, dreaming of a better life for himself and his family, leaves his rural Bengal village in search of work.

title: City Lights
sas_caption: A purely beautiful outing from the Tramp, this delightful urban romance features one of cinema’s most heartbreaking smiles.
imdb_caption: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

title: M
sas_caption: Fritz Lang’s rack-taut first talkie, with a searing, animalistic Peter Lorre as a serial child-murderer turned manhunt target.
imdb_caption: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.

title: Rear Window
sas_caption: The Master of Suspense ratchets up the tension while dishing out insights into obsession, urban living and the dangers of the gaze.
imdb_caption: A photographer in a wheelchair spies on his neighbors from his Greenwich Village courtyard apartment window, and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder, despite the skepticism of his fashion-model girlfriend.

title: Some Like It Hot
sas_caption: Billy Wilder’s supreme gender-bending comedy has Jack Lemmon and Tony Curtis as female-posing musicians on the lam, and many knickers in a twist.
imdb_caption: After two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

title: À bout de souffle
sas_caption: Jean-Luc Godard’s cock-of-the-walk calling card, mixing pulp pastiche and upstart rebellion with Jean-Paul Belmondo’s footloose Parisian delinquent.
imdb_caption: A small-time thief steals a car and impulsively murders a motorcycle policeman. Wanted by the authorities, he reunites with a hip American journalism student and attempts to persuade her to run away with him to Italy.

title: Bicycle Thieves
sas_caption: The film that topped Sight and Sound’s inaugural Greatest Films of All Time poll in 1952, Vittorio De Sica’s indelible neorealist parable offers a sharp-eyed portrait of Italy’s post-war privations.
imdb_caption: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen, endangering his efforts to find work. He and his son set out to find it.

title: Rashomon
sas_caption: The film that brought Japanese cinema to the world, this 88-minute firecracker proved a seminal assault on the notion of objectivity.
imdb_caption: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.

title: Killer of Sheep
sas_caption: Charles Burnett’s tender and witty tale of a disillusioned slaughterhouse worker and the solace to be found in the simplest moments of life.
imdb_caption: Set in the Watts area of Los Angeles, a slaughterhouse worker must suspend his emotions to continue working at a job he finds repugnant, and then he finds he has little sensitivity for the family he works so hard to support.

title: Stalker
sas_caption: Two men recruit a guide to take them into ‘the Zone’, a mysterious realm where one’s innermost wishes come true, in this metaphysical sci-fi epic.
imdb_caption: A guide leads two men through an area known as the Zone to find a room that grants wishes.

title: Barry Lyndon
sas_caption: Stanley Kubrick’s meticulously designed epic recounts the picaresque exploits of an 18th-century Irish adventurer.
imdb_caption: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

title: North by Northwest
sas_caption: Insouciant big-screen thrill-games from the Master of Suspense, hounding Cary Grant’s smug adman across a continent’s span of peerless set pieces.
imdb_caption: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and falls for a woman whose loyalties he begins to doubt.

title: The Battle of Algiers
sas_caption: A window on Algeria’s wider liberation war, recreating a violent phase of guerrilla struggle and suppression in powerful free-documentary style.
imdb_caption: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.

title: Ordet
sas_caption: An austere parable on the power of faith, Carl Theodor Dreyer’s penultimate film culminates in a transcendent resurrection scene.
imdb_caption: Follows the lives of the Borgen family, as they deal with inner conflict, as well as religious conflict with each other, and the rest of the town.

title: Wanda
sas_caption: Barbara Loden’s tough, unsentimental portrait of a woman adrift in the industrial heartlands of the north-eastern United States.
imdb_caption: Wanda, a lonely housewife, drifts through mining country until she meets a petty thief who takes her in.

title: The 400 Blows
sas_caption: François Truffaut’s free-wheeling debut, with Jean-Pierre Léaud as his rebel-schoolboy surrogate, is still a banner film for nouvelle vague lyric realism.
imdb_caption: A young boy, left without attention, delves into a life of petty crime.

title: The Piano
sas_caption: This virtuoso drama of a mute woman’s and her daughter’s silent defiance of patriarchy in 19th-century New Zealand still has searing emotional heft.
imdb_caption: In the mid-19th century a mute woman is sent to New Zealand along with her young daughter and prized piano for an arranged marriage to a farmer, but is soon lusted after by a farm worker.

title: Fear Eats the Soul
sas_caption: Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s heart-on-sleeve melodrama of a doomed romance across racial and age divides probes social hypocrisy with feeling.
imdb_caption: A lonely widow meets a much younger Moroccan worker in a bar during a rainstorm. They fall in love, to their own surprise and to the outright shock of their families, colleagues, and drinking buddies.

title: News from Home
sas_caption: Chantal Akerman’s epistolary film, shot in the grime of 70s New York, bridges the distance from Brussels through dictated letters from her mother.
imdb_caption: Impersonal and beautiful images of Akerman's life in New York are combined with letters from her loving but manipulative mother, read by Akerman herself.

title: Battleship Potemkin
sas_caption: Sergei Eisenstein’s renowned agit-drama of proto-revolutionary mutiny and repression, often quoted but still powerful in its montage effects.
imdb_caption: In the midst of the Russian Revolution of 1905, the crew of the battleship Potemkin mutiny against the brutal, tyrannical regime of the vessel's officers. The resulting street demonstration in Odessa brings on a police massacre.

title: Blade Runner
sas_caption: Iconic neo-noir in a befouled sci-fi Los Angeles where humans and their machine replicas vie to be predators rather than prey.
imdb_caption: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.

title: Le Mépris
sas_caption: Disillusion in love and cinema in Jean-Luc Godard’s most opulent and emotive production, with lovers and film legends at loggerheads in Capri.
imdb_caption: Screenwriter Paul Javal's marriage to his wife Camille disintegrates during movie production as she spends time with the producer. Layered conflicts between art and business ensue.

title: Sherlock Jr.
sas_caption: Buster Keaton’s would-be sleuth dreams himself into movie-heroic mastery in this dazzling, evergreen, meta masterpiece of silent comedy.
imdb_caption: A film projectionist longs to be a detective, and puts his meagre skills to work when he is framed by a rival for stealing his girlfriend's father's pocketwatch.

title: The Apartment
sas_caption: Billy Wilder’s then-risqué romcom, with Jack Lemmon and Shirley Maclaine finding love amid corporate New York’s sea of sexual deception.
imdb_caption: A Manhattan insurance clerk tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.

title: Sans Soleil
sas_caption: Chris Marker’s speculative travelogue-essay, reflecting on culture and history in narrated letters from Guinea to Japan to Iceland.
imdb_caption: A woman narrates the contemplative writings of a seasoned world traveler, focusing on contemporary Japan.

title: Daughters of the Dust
sas_caption: Julie Dash’s visionary visual marriage between Afrocentric aesthetics and the rich emotional depth of Black womanhood is a cinematic triumph.
imdb_caption: A languid, impressionistic story of three generations of Gullah women living on the South Carolina Sea Islands in 1902.

title: La dolce vita
sas_caption: Federico Fellini’s ode to Rome presents a lush, vibrant exterior to the swinging city, before revealing its rotting moral core.
imdb_caption: A series of stories following a week in the life of a philandering tabloid journalist living in Rome.

title: Moonlight
sas_caption: Instantly heralded as a modern masterpiece, Barry Jenkins’ stunning three-part story of queer identity is both a technical and an emotional marvel.
imdb_caption: A young African-American man grapples with his identity and sexuality while experiencing the everyday struggles of childhood, adolescence, and burgeoning adulthood.

title: Casablanca
sas_caption: Ingrid Bergman rallies Humphrey Bogart’s embittered cynic to the anti-Nazi cause in this classic romance.
imdb_caption: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

title: GoodFellas
sas_caption: The dizzying story of wiseguy Henry Hill, from his seduction into a life of crime to his paranoid, cocaine-fuelled departure.
imdb_caption: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

title: The Third Man
sas_caption: Joseph Cotten chases Orson Welles’s agent of corruption through the ruins of divided post-war Vienna in this evocative classic thriller.
imdb_caption: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

title: Touki Bouki
sas_caption: A restless young couple dream of escaping Senegal for Paris in Djibril Diop Mambéty ’s stylish, poetic, irreverent expression of post-colonial fantasies.
imdb_caption: Mory, a cowherd, and Anta, a university student, try to make money in order to go to Paris and leave their boring past behind.

title: Andrei Rublev
sas_caption: Andrei Tarkovsky’s epic portrait of a medieval artist may be the most wrenching depiction of belief, creativity and the search for meaning ever filmed.
imdb_caption: The life, times and afflictions of the fifteenth-century Russian iconographer St. Andrei Rublev.

title: La Jetée
sas_caption: The rare short film in this list, Marker’s dazzling photo montage ruminates on memory from beyond the apocalypse.
imdb_caption: The story of a man forced to explore his memories in the wake of World War III's devastation, told through still images.

title: Metropolis
sas_caption: Fritz Lang’s bombastic, stylised depiction of a future of profound inequality has influenced generations of genre filmmakers.
imdb_caption: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working-class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.

title: The Gleaners and I
sas_caption: Agnès Varda’s essay portrait of society ’s scavenger-recyclers – herself included – is both free-radical and infectious.
imdb_caption: Varda films and interviews gleaners in France in all forms, from those picking fields after the harvest to those scouring the dumpsters of Paris.

title: The Red Shoes
sas_caption: The feverish Technicolor and astonishing ballet sequences for which this film is so renowned are as spellbinding as they are disturbing.
imdb_caption: A young ballet dancer is torn between the man she loves and her pursuit to become a prima ballerina.

title: Journey to Italy
sas_caption: Roberto Rossellini’s plaintively simple portrait of a marriage on the rocks, imprinted with the ghosts of love, cultures and civilisations.
imdb_caption: An unhappily married couple attempts to find direction and insight while vacationing in Naples.

title: L'avventura
sas_caption: Michelangelo Antonioni’s high-modernist breakthrough sends Monica Vitti in search less of her disappeared friend than her own self, via images to get lost in.
imdb_caption: A woman disappears during a Mediterranean boating trip. During the search, her lover and her best friend become attracted to each other.

title: My Neighbour Totoro
sas_caption: The storytelling is as simple as Totoro is inscrutable, unfolding in a series of delightful, exquisitely constructed sequences.
imdb_caption: When two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother, they have adventures with the wondrous forest spirits who live nearby.

title: Imitation of Life
sas_caption: Douglas Sirk’s melodrama holds a mirror to the hypocrisies of 1950s America with its pairs of mothers and daughters across class and racial divides.
imdb_caption: An aspiring white actress takes in an African American widow whose mixed-race daughter is desperate to be seen as white.

title: Sansho the Bailiff
sas_caption: Kenji Mizoguchi’s tragic folk saga of the tribulations of an exiled governor’s family in feudal Japan, tracked with exquisitely moving camerawork.
imdb_caption: In medieval Japan, a compassionate governor is sent into exile. His wife and children try to join him, but are separated, and the children grow up amid suffering and oppression.

title: Spirited Away
sas_caption: Hayao Miyazaki’s rich anime fantasy follows its ten-year-old heroine into the labyrinth of a spirit-world bathhouse, teeming with phantoms and peril.
imdb_caption: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches and spirits, a world where humans are changed into beasts.

title: A Brighter Summer Day
sas_caption: Young love and teen delinquency in Taiwan’s early 1960s adolescence, in Edward Yang’s slow-burn, bittersweet epic.
imdb_caption: Based on a true story, primarily on a conflict between two youth gangs, a 14-year-old boy's girlfriend conflicts with the head of one gang for an unclear reason, until finally the conflict comes to a violent climax.

title: A Matter of Life and Death
sas_caption: Love is rescued from the jaws of the afterlife in the Archers’ delirious World War II air-pilot fantasia.
imdb_caption: A British wartime aviator who cheats death must argue for his life before a celestial court, hoping to prolong his fledgling romance with an American girl.

title: Céline and Julie Go Boating
sas_caption: Jacques Rivette’s most playful, innovative frolic, in which his irreverent Parisian heroines dissolve worlds, genres, social codes and boundaries.
imdb_caption: A mysteriously linked pair of young women find their daily lives preempted by a strange boudoir melodrama that plays itself out in a hallucinatory parallel reality.

title: Histoire(s) du Cinéma
sas_caption: The apotheosis of Jean-Luc Godard’s experimental era, this sprawling essay film indicts the 20th century through its most popular medium.
imdb_caption: An 8-part documentary chronicling the history of cinema, examining the history of the concept of cinema and how both relates to the 20th century.

title: Modern Times
sas_caption: Industrial modernity proves mercilessly madcap in Charlie Chaplin’s final (mostly) silent feature, one of the most inspired and ingenious of all his comedies.
imdb_caption: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

title: Sunset Blvd.
sas_caption: Tinseltown’s greatest self-satire, a gothic requiem for big-screen bygones and the highs of screen stardom.
imdb_caption: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

title: Sátántangó
sas_caption: As timely as ever in its grim poeticisation of demagogues and doom, helplessness and hope. If music be the food of death, play on.
imdb_caption: On the eve of a large payment, residents of a collapsing collective farm see their plans turn into desolation when they discover that Irimiás, a former co-worker who they thought was dead, is returning to the community.

title: Blue Velvet
sas_caption: David Lynch’s adult fairytale follows teen sleuth Kyle MacLachlan’s murder inquiry into the surreal, perverse corners of small-town America.
imdb_caption: The discovery of a severed human ear found in a field leads a young man on an investigation related to a beautiful, mysterious nightclub singer and a group of psychopathic criminals who have kidnapped her child.

title: Pierrot le fou
sas_caption: Jean-Luc Godard’s most effervescent escapade, a primary-coloured lovers-on-the-run blow-out heading south with Anna Karina and Jean-Paul Belmondo.
imdb_caption: Pierrot escapes his boring society and travels from Paris to the Mediterranean Sea with Marianne, a girl chased by hit-men from Algeria. They lead an unorthodox life, always on the run.

title: The Spirit of the Beehive
sas_caption: Victor Erice’s exquisite impressionistic distillation of childhood fear and wonder in the ruins of the recently ended Spanish Civil War.
imdb_caption: In 1940, after watching and being traumatized by the movie Frankenstein (1931), a sensitive seven year-old girl living in a small Spanish village drifts into her own fantasy world.

title: Chungking Express
sas_caption: A sense of wistful, romantic longing joins the two stories in Wong Kar Wai’s freewheeling portmanteau portrait of Hong Kong.
imdb_caption: Two melancholy Hong Kong policemen fall in love: one with a mysterious female underworld figure, the other with a beautiful and ethereal waitress at a late-night restaurant he frequents.

title: The Shining
sas_caption: Stanley Kubrick’s much analysed and often spoofed psychological horror spends a chilling and claustrophobic winter at the empty Overlook Hotel.
imdb_caption: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

title: Madame de...
sas_caption: Max Ophuls’ woozy whirligig tracks a pair of unwanted earrings around high-society Paris – until they bear the weight of lost time and passion.
imdb_caption: When an aristocratic woman known only as "Madame de . . ." sells a pair of earrings given to her by her husband in order to pay some debts, she sets off a chain reaction of financial and carnal consequences that can end only in despair.

title: Parasite
sas_caption: Like Get Out, Bong Joon Ho’s endlessly twisty, blackly sincere class-war thriller is a pop provocation for our unequal times.
imdb_caption: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

title: The Leopard
sas_caption: Luchino Visconti’s sumptuous epic portrays the fall of 19th-century Sicilian nobility, its decadent displays of wealth tinged with melancholy.
imdb_caption: The Prince of Salina, a noble aristocrat of impeccable integrity, tries to preserve his family and class amid the tumultuous social upheavals of 1860s Sicily.

title: Ugetsu Monogatari
sas_caption: Kenji Mizoguchi’s bewitching, insinuating Edo-period ghost story renders civil war as a parable of heedless male greed.
